name: IDEA Lab Tracker
overview: The IDEA Lab Tracker was a website designed for the IDEA Lab, a place for students to build and develop hands on projects, in the School of Enginnering, Technology, and Aeronautics (SETA) at Southern New Hampshire University. This project was part of a class CS-340 Client/Server Development. This project requiered us to meet with stake holders and a team in the class to develop the website. This website was built using Angular and Python. The Python backend was used to create a connection between the Angular frontend and the database.
description: This project is designed to track all screws, nuts, and components in the IDEA Lab. We chose a website design to be easily accessable from other devices. This project has multiple pages such as a home for searching, admin page for part adjustments, admin section to create users, and a database page to backup, restore, and upload a database.
what_i_learned: I learned a lot about the development of a website and how to do UI/UX design. The knowledge i gainded from this project led me to wanting to take on the challenge of building this portfolio website.
challenges: This project marked my first experience working on a full website from the ground up, as well as my first time collaborating directly with clients. Navigating client communication and translating their needs into technical requirements was a new but valuable challenge. Additionally, following the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) in a structured environment required me to adapt to planning, iterative development, and stakeholder feedback loops. Balancing technical implementation with clear documentation and client expectations helped me grow significantly as both a developer and a communicator.
